[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Bank Management System (BMS) defines requirements for managing accounts, financial transactions, and stock trading.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: BMS supports account management, savings, interest calculations, stock trading, and reporting.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: BMS integrates with stock exchanges, tax services, and customer databases.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: BMS provides web and mobile platforms for account and investment management.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: BMS supports ATMs, banking terminals, and secure mobile devices.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: BMS uses PostgreSQL for storage  REST APIs for transactions  account operations  and stock trading.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: BMS ensures encrypted transactions via TLS and two-factor authentication.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: BMS is optimized for high-frequency transactions and real-time stock data.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: BMS handles deposits, withdrawals, stock trades, and interest calculations.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: BMS is configurable for banking institutions with custom policies.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: BMS integrates with fraud detection, taxation, and reporting systems.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: BMS manages customer accounts, transactions, stock investments, interest applications, and commissions.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: BMS is designed for customers  bank staff  and investors needing secure financial tools.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: BMS requires internet connectivity for real-time transactions.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: BMS relies on real-time market data  secure authentication  and compliance rules.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with customer databases for authentication and account management.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall connect with stock trading platforms to execute buy and sell orders.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow customers to open and manage savings and investment accounts (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall apply interest to savings accounts at set intervals (REQ-DB-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall allow users to trade stocks by specifying ticker, quantity, and order type (REQ-DB-003).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-004: The system shall apply a commission on stock transactions, deducted from the transaction (REQ-DB-003).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide a dashboard for tracking accounts and investments.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process financial transactions with minimal delay.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store customer details  including name  address  account type  and balance.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall store savings balances  accrued interest  and transaction history.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-003: The system shall store stock trades  including ticker  quantity  fees  and timestamps.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall enforce encryption and multi-factor authentication.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with banking security regulations  financial monitoring  and anti-money laundering policies.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall log account activities  stock trades  and transactions for auditing.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Tests accounts, transactions, trades, and interest.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, API documentation, and banking compliance manuals.
[SEC] 5. References: Financial regulations, stock trading policies, and security standards.
